content: so I've spent the better part of this week using macOS without the dock. It's been interesting. You really dont need it as much as you might think.
I've spent the better part of the last two months seriously using a Mac for the first time, and I cannot wait to get off it. The key combinations have totally screwed up my muscle memory.

I just got a new laptop and decided to try something a bit different (was previously using Linux Mint Cinnamon). I decided to try Elementary OS (which has a Mac-like look and feel to it), but ultimately it wasn't as customisable as I needed it to be. I still wanted something different, so then I tried Ubuntu Budgie. It had a similar look and feel as Elementary, but was much more customisable. However after a while I noticed a few things I didn't like. I ended up going back to Linux Mint as that's what I'm comfortable with and can work much better with it. But I might try Budgie again in the future and see if spending some more time with it doesn't fix the issues I was having...

image.png

I found a couple extensions to make macOS behave more like Mac OS 9. Double click on a title bar to collapse the window and an application switcher in the menu bar.
